title: Optimization-Informed Neural Networks. (arXiv:2210.02113v3 [math.OC] UPDATED)
abstract: Solving constrained nonlinear optimization problems (CNLPs) is a longstanding problem that arises in various fields, e.g., economics, computer science, and engineering. We propose optimization-informed neural networks (OINN), a deep learning approach to solve CNLPs. By neurodynamic optimization methods, a CNLP is first reformulated as an initial value problem (IVP) involving an ordinary differential equation (ODE) system. A neural network model is then used as an approximate solution for this IVP, with the endpoint being the prediction to the CNLP. We propose a novel training algorithm that directs the model to hold the best prediction during training. In a nutshell, OINN transforms a CNLP into a neural network training problem. By doing so, we can solve CNLPs based on deep learning infrastructure only, without using standard optimization solvers or numerical integration solvers.
